items.title: State Department Boosts Resources to Process Business Visas for South Koreans
items.summary: The Trump administration has been trying to repair the damage from the detention of hundreds of South Koreans in an immigration raid in Georgia.

items.title: Northwestern Agrees to Deal With Trump Administration
items.summary: The university will pay $75 million to regain its research funding and end investigations, the second highest payment by a school facing pressure from the administration.

items.title: Two West Virginia Communities Bound Together by Grief
items.summary: Red ribbons adorned one city, while blue ribbons hung in another town — all to honor the National Guard members who were attacked in Washington this week.

items.title: Trump Pauses All Asylum Applications and Halts Visas for Afghans
items.summary: They were the latest restrictive changes to the immigration system after this week’s shooting of two National Guard members.

items.title: Trump Spoke by Phone Last Week With Maduro, Venezuela’s Leader
items.summary: They discussed a possible meeting between the two of them, but nothing has been scheduled, and the administration continues to increase the military pressure on Venezuela.

items.title: Trump’s Response to Shooting Shows Intensified Anti-Migrant Stance
items.summary: The president is furiously demanding limits on migration and attacking ethnic groups as he steps up his efforts to equate immigration with crime and economic distress.

items.title: US halts all asylum decisions after National Guard shooting
items.summary: <p>Trump administration says decisions paused until government can ensure ‘every alien is vetted and screened to the maximum degree possible’</p><p>The Trump administration has announced it is halting all asylum decisions in the wake of the National Guard <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/26/national-guard-soldiers-shot-washington-dc">shooting in Washington DC</a>, according to a senior immigration official.</p><p>Joseph Edlow, the director of US Citizenship and Immigration Services, said in a post on X on Friday that asylum decisions would be paused “until we can ensure that every alien is vetted and screened to the maximum degree possible”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/29/us-halts-all-asylum-decisions-after-national-guard-shooting">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: What is an autopen and why can’t Trump stop talking about it?
items.summary: <p>The first autopen was patented in the 1800s and has been used by many American presidents</p><p>On Friday, Donald Trump claimed that he will reverse everything that Joe Biden has signed with an autopen.</p><p>The automated signature machine has been a tool used by presidents at the White House for decades.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/29/what-is-an-autopen-and-why-cant-trump-stop-talking-about-it">Continue reading...</a>
